title: Synthetic Recap
body:
WASHINGTON – Gheorghe Muresan did not just beat the Orlando Magic; he delivered a performance of such historic and overwhelming force that it will be etched in the annals of the NBA.

In a dominant 102-82 victory for the Washington Bullets, the 7-foot-7 center from Romania was an unstoppable force, pouring in a career-high and franchise-record 42 points. Muresan’s sheer dominance in the paint rendered the Magic helpless, as he converted an astonishing 18 of his 22 field goal attempts, a testament to his impeccable touch around the rim.

From the opening tip, it was clear the Bullets’ strategy was to feed their gentle giant. Muresan was a whirlwind of activity, catching entry passes and finishing with a variety of soft hooks and dunks. He was not merely a scorer; his all-around game was on full display as he corralled 14 rebounds and swatted away 3 Magic shots, anchoring a Washington defense that suffocated Orlando all night.

While Muresan orchestrated his masterpiece, his backcourt provided the perfect accompaniment. Rod Strickland dished out 15 assists, many of them lobs or precision passes to the towering center, while Calbert Cheaney added 22 points as a lethal secondary option.

The Magic, simply put, had no answer. Their 82-point total was a season-low, a direct result of being overwhelmed by the Bullets' interior presence. Penny Hardaway’s 19 points and Shaquille O’Neal’s 17 were rendered inconsequential in the face of Muresan’s historic night.

In the end, the scoreboard told the story of a convincing team win. But the lasting memory from this 1997 clash was the night Gheorghe Muresan stood tallest of all, delivering a legendary 42-point performance that shattered records and left an entire franchise, and its opponent, in awe.
